title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 901.16 - Application for dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 901.16 - Application for dissolution of a not-for-profit corporation

State Regulations
(a) Not-for-profit corporations seeking the
approval of the Life Care Community Council of a voluntary dissolution shall
file information, documents and data as follows: (1)
the public need for such
dissolution; (2)
the proposed
disposition of the assets of the corporation; (3)
the proposed certificate of dissolution
which shall in all respects conform with the applicable provisions of the

Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and all other pertinent laws of the State of New

York; (4)
the proposed plan of
dissolution and distribution of assets which shall in all respects conform with
the applicable provisions of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and all other
pertinent laws of the State of New York; (5)
the petition proposed to be submitted to
the court in support of the application for judicial approval of the proposed
plan of dissolution and distribution of assets; and
(6)
such additional pertinent information and
documents which are deemed necessary for the council's consideration as
requested. (b) If the
council approves the dissolution of the corporation, such approval shall be
contingent upon the approval of the plan of dissolution and distribution of
assets by a court of competent jurisdiction and the filing of a certified copy
of the court order of such approval. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
ยง
901.16

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
